page.title: 06NEWPORT HARBOUR FACILITIES
page.content: At the present time Newport Harbour is undergoing many changes with the view to accommodating visiting yachting families and leisure boating. Pontoons are being laid in the harbour to facilitate landing and portacabins are being provided for toilet and washing facilities. During 1984 between March and November some 3000 yachts made overnight stays in the harbour. The highest number staying any one night being 34. The cost per night averages Â£2. Connections for mains electricity supplies are now being made. Six houseboats have permanent moorings in the harbour. During the summer months a small pleasure boat provides trips up the River Medina as far as Cowes. Visiting pleasure boats can have a 6 hour stay returing on the same tide..
